notes.text:
Red Hat JBoss Core Services httpd 2.4.23 is now available from the Red Hat Customer Portal for Solaris and Microsoft Windows systems.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this release as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This release of Red Hat JBoss Core Services httpd 2.4.23 serves as a replacement for JBoss Core Services Apache HTTP Server 2.4.6.

Security Fix(es):

* This update fixes several flaws in OpenSSL. (CVE-2014-8176, CVE-2015-0209, CVE-2015-0286, CVE-2015-3194, CVE-2015-3195, CVE-2015-3196, CVE-2015-3216, CVE-2016-0702, CVE-2016-0705, CVE-2016-0797, CVE-2016-0799, CVE-2016-2105, CVE-2016-2106, CVE-2016-2107, CVE-2016-2108, CVE-2016-2109, CVE-2016-2177, CVE-2016-2178, CVE-2016-2842)

* This update fixes several flaws in libxml2. (CVE-2016-1762, CVE-2016-1833, CVE-2016-1834, CVE-2016-1835, CVE-2016-1836, CVE-2016-1837, CVE-2016-1838, CVE-2016-1839, CVE-2016-1840, CVE-2016-3627, CVE-2016-3705, CVE-2016-4447, CVE-2016-4448, CVE-2016-4449, CVE-2016-4483)

* This update fixes three flaws in curl. (CVE-2016-5419, CVE-2016-5420, CVE-2016-7141)

* This update fixes two flaws in httpd. (CVE-2014-3523, CVE-2015-3185)

* This update fixes two flaws in mod_cluster. (CVE-2016-4459, CVE-2016-8612)

* A buffer overflow flaw when concatenating virtual host names and URIs was fixed in mod_jk. (CVE-2016-6808)

* A memory leak flaw was fixed in expat. (CVE-2012-1148)

Red Hat would like to thank the OpenSSL project for reporting CVE-2014-8176, CVE-2015-0286, CVE-2016-2108, CVE-2016-2105, CVE-2016-2106, CVE-2016-2107, CVE-2016-0702, CVE-2016-0705, CVE-2016-0797, CVE-2016-0799, and CVE-2016-2842. The CVE-2016-4459 issue was discovered by Robert Bost (Red Hat). Upstream acknowledges Stephen Henson (OpenSSL development team) as the original reporter of CVE-2015-0286; Huzaifa Sidhpurwala (Red Hat), Hanno Böck, and David Benjamin (Google) as the original reporters of CVE-2016-2108; Guido Vranken as the original reporter of CVE-2016-2105, CVE-2016-2106, CVE-2016-0797, CVE-2016-0799, and CVE-2016-2842; Juraj Somorovsky as the original reporter of CVE-2016-2107; Yuval Yarom (University of Adelaide and NICTA), Daniel Genkin (Technion and Tel Aviv University), and Nadia Heninger (University of Pennsylvania) as the original reporters of CVE-2016-0702; and Adam Langley (Google/BoringSSL) as the original reporter of CVE-2016-0705.

See the corresponding CVE pages linked to in the References section for more information about each of the flaws listed in this advisory.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat JBoss Core Services Apache HTTP 2.4.23 Release

notes.text: A denial of service flaw was found in the implementation of hash arrays in Expat. An attacker could use this flaw to make an application using Expat consume an excessive amount of CPU time by providing a specially crafted XML file that triggers multiple hash function collisions. To mitigate this issue, randomization has been added to the hash function to reduce the chance of an attacker successfully causing intentional collisions.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: expat: hash table collisions CPU usage DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update). Before applying the update, back up your existing Red Hat JBoss Web Server installation (including all applications and configuration files).

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: expat: hash table collisions CPU usage DoS

cwe.name: Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime

notes.text: A memory leak flaw was found in Expat. If an XML file processed by an application linked against Expat triggered a memory re-allocation failure, Expat failed to free the previously allocated memory. This could cause the application to exit unexpectedly or crash when all available memory is exhausted.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: expat: Memory leak in poolGrow
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: expat: Memory leak in poolGrow

notes.text: Memory leak in the winnt_accept function in server/mpm/winnt/child.c in the WinNT MPM in the Apache HTTP Server 2.4.x before 2.4.10 on Windows, when the default AcceptFilter is enabled, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via crafted requests.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: httpd: WinNT MPM denial of service
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Not affected. This issue did not affect the versions of httpd as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6 and 7, Red Hat JBoss Web Server 1 and 2, and Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5 and 6. This flaw only affects httpd running on Microsoft Windows. Red Hat JBoss Web Server 1 and 2, and Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 5 and 6 can be run on Microsoft Windows. However, these products provide httpd 2.2, which is not affected by this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: httpd: WinNT MPM denial of service

notes.text: An invalid-free flaw was found in the way OpenSSL handled certain DTLS handshake messages. A malicious DTLS client or server could send a specially crafted message to the peer, which could cause the application to crash or potentially result in arbitrary code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenSSL: Invalid free in DTLS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue does NOT affect the version of OpenSSL package as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: OpenSSL: Invalid free in DTLS

notes.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in the way OpenSSL imported malformed Elliptic Curve private keys. A specially crafted key file could cause an application using OpenSSL to crash when imported.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openssl: use-after-free on invalid EC private key import
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: An invalid pointer use flaw was found in OpenSSL's ASN1_TYPE_cmp() function. A remote attacker could crash a TLS/SSL client or server using OpenSSL via a specially crafted X.509 certificate when the attacker-supplied certificate was verified by the application.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openssl: invalid pointer use in ASN1_TYPE_cmp()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: openssl: invalid pointer use in ASN1_TYPE_cmp()

notes.text: It was discovered that in httpd 2.4, the internal API function ap_some_auth_required() could incorrectly indicate that a request was authenticated even when no authentication was used. An httpd module using this API function could consequently allow access that should have been denied.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: httpd: ap_some_auth_required() does not properly indicate authenticated request in 2.4
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: httpd: ap_some_auth_required() does not properly indicate authenticated request in 2.4

notes.text: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the way OpenSSL verified signatures using the RSA PSS algorithm. A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to crash a TLS/SSL client using OpenSSL, or a TLS/SSL server using OpenSSL if it enabled client authentication.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenSSL: Certificate verify crash with missing PSS parameter
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: OpenSSL: Certificate verify crash with missing PSS parameter

cwe.name: Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime

notes.text: A memory leak vulnerability was found in the way OpenSSL parsed PKCS#7 and CMS data. A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause an application that parses PKCS#7 or CMS data from untrusted sources to use an excessive amount of memory and possibly crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenSSL: X509_ATTRIBUTE memory leak

notes.text: A race condition flaw, leading to a double free, was found in the way OpenSSL handled pre-shared key (PSK) identify hints. A remote attacker could use this flaw to crash a multi-threaded SSL/TLS client using OpenSSL.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenSSL: Race condition handling PSK identify hint
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: A regression was found in the ssleay_rand_bytes() function in the versions of OpenSSL shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7. This regression could cause a multi-threaded application to crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openssl: Crash in ssleay_rand_bytes due to locking regression
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue does not affect the version of OpenSSL package as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

notes.text: A side-channel attack was found that makes use of cache-bank conflicts on the Intel Sandy-Bridge microarchitecture. An attacker who has the ability to control code in a thread running on the same hyper-threaded core as the victim's thread that is performing decryption, could use this flaw to recover RSA private keys.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenSSL: Side channel attack on modular exponentiation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: OpenSSL: Side channel attack on modular exponentiation

notes.text: A double-free flaw was found in the way OpenSSL parsed certain malformed DSA (Digital Signature Algorithm) private keys. An attacker could create specially crafted DSA private keys that, when processed by an application compiled against OpenSSL, could cause the application to crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenSSL: Double-free in DSA code
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

vulnerabilities.title: OpenSSL: Double-free in DSA code

notes.text: An integer overflow flaw, leading to a NULL pointer dereference or a heap-based memory corruption, was found in the way some BIGNUM functions of OpenSSL were implemented. Applications that use these functions with large untrusted input could crash or, potentially, execute arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenSSL: BN_hex2bn/BN_dec2bn NULL pointer deref/heap corruption

vulnerabilities.title: OpenSSL: BN_hex2bn/BN_dec2bn NULL pointer deref/heap corruption

notes.text: Several flaws were found in the way BIO_*printf functions were implemented in OpenSSL. Applications which passed large amounts of untrusted data through these functions could crash or potentially execute code with the permissions of the user running such an application.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenSSL: Fix memory issues in BIO_*printf functions
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
The original issue fixed by OpenSSL upstream contains two distinct fixes. The first one is a format string flaw in the internal fmtstr functions, which may result in a OOB read flaw when printing very large string. This issue was assigned CVE-2016-0799

The second issue relates to the internal doapr_outch function of OpenSSL. It can result in an OOB write, or cause memory leaks. This issue has been assigned CVE-2016-2842 by MITRE as is now tracked as https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2016-2842
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: OpenSSL: Fix memory issues in BIO_*printf functions

notes.text: An integer overflow flaw, leading to a buffer overflow, was found in the way the EVP_EncodeUpdate() function of OpenSSL parsed very large amounts of input data. A remote attacker could use this flaw to crash an application using OpenSSL or, possibly, execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running that application.

remediations.details:
The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update). Before applying the update, back up your existing Red Hat JBoss Web Server installation (including all applications and configuration files).

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: openssl: EVP_EncryptUpdate overflow

notes.text: It was discovered that OpenSSL leaked timing information when decrypting TLS/SSL and DTLS protocol encrypted records when the connection used the AES CBC cipher suite and the server supported AES-NI. A remote attacker could possibly use this flaw to retrieve plain text from encrypted packets by using a TLS/SSL or DTLS server as a padding oracle.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openssl: Padding oracle in AES-NI CBC MAC check
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update). Before applying the update, back up your existing Red Hat JBoss Web Server installation (including all applications and configuration files).

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: openssl: Padding oracle in AES-NI CBC MAC check

notes.text: A flaw was found in the way OpenSSL encoded certain ASN.1 data structures. An attacker could use this flaw to create a specially crafted certificate which, when verified or re-encoded by OpenSSL, could cause it to crash, or execute arbitrary code using the permissions of the user running an application compiled against the OpenSSL library.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openssl: Memory corruption in the ASN.1 encoder
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update). Before applying the update, back up your existing Red Hat JBoss Web Server installation (including all applications and configuration files).

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: openssl: Memory corruption in the ASN.1 encoder

notes.text: A denial of service flaw was found in the way OpenSSL parsed certain ASN.1-encoded data from BIO (OpenSSL's I/O abstraction) inputs. An application using OpenSSL that accepts untrusted ASN.1 BIO input could be forced to allocate an excessive amount of data.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openssl: ASN.1 BIO handling of large amounts of data
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: openssl: ASN.1 BIO handling of large amounts of data

notes.text: Multiple integer overflow flaws were found in the way OpenSSL performed pointer arithmetic. A remote attacker could possibly use these flaws to cause a TLS/SSL server or client using OpenSSL to crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openssl: Possible integer overflow vulnerabilities in codebase
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: openssl: Possible integer overflow vulnerabilities in codebase

notes.text: It was discovered that OpenSSL did not always use constant time operations when computing Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA) signatures. A local attacker could possibly use this flaw to obtain a private DSA key belonging to another user or service running on the same system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openssl: Non-constant time codepath followed for certain operations in DSA implementation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: openssl: Non-constant time codepath followed for certain operations in DSA implementation

notes.text: Several flaws were found in the way BIO_*printf functions were implemented in OpenSSL. Applications which passed large amounts of untrusted data through these functions could crash or potentially execute code with the permissions of the user running such an application.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: openssl: doapr_outch function does not verify that certain memory allocation succeeds
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Missing recursive loop detection checks were found in the xmlParserEntityCheck() and xmlStringGetNodeList() functions of libxml2, causing application using the library to crash by stack exhaustion while building the associated data. An attacker able to send XML data to be parsed in recovery mode could launch a Denial of Service on the application.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: stack exhaustion while parsing xml files in recovery mode
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update). Before applying the update, back up your existing Red Hat JBoss Web Server installation (including all applications and configuration files).

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: libxml2: stack exhaustion while parsing xml files in recovery mode

notes.text: Missing incrementation of recursion depth counter were found in the xmlParserEntityCheck() and xmlParseAttValueComplex() functions used for parsing XML data. An attacker could launch a Denial of Service attack by passing specially crafted XML data to an application, forcing it to crash due to stack exhaustion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: stack overflow before detecting invalid XML file
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: libxml2: stack overflow before detecting invalid XML file

notes.text: The xmlParseElementDecl function in parser.c in libxml2 before 2.9.4 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer underread and application crash) via a crafted file, involving xmlParseName.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: Heap-based buffer underreads due to xmlParseName

notes.text: XML external entity (XXE) vulnerability in the xmlStringLenDecodeEntities function in parser.c in libxml2 before 2.9.4, when not in validating mode, allows context-dependent attackers to read arbitrary files or cause a denial of service (resource consumption) via unspecified vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: It was discovered that specifying configuration with a JVMRoute path longer than 80 characters will cause segmentation fault leading to a server crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: mod_cluster: Buffer overflow in mod_manager when sending request with long JVMRoute
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

vulnerabilities.title: mod_cluster: Buffer overflow in mod_manager when sending request with long JVMRoute

notes.text: The xmlBufAttrSerializeTxtContent function in xmlsave.c in libxml2 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a non-UTF-8 attribute value, related to serialization.  NOTE: this vulnerability may be a duplicate of CVE-2016-3627.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxml2: out-of-bounds read
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: When a specially-crafted XML file is parsed via an application compiled against libxml2, this can cause the application to crash. (No code execution)
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: libxml2: out-of-bounds read

notes.text: It was found that the libcurl library did not prevent TLS session resumption when the client certificate had changed. An attacker could potentially use this flaw to hijack the authentication of the connection by leveraging a previously created connection with a different client certificate.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: curl: TLS session resumption client cert bypass
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: curl: TLS session resumption client cert bypass

notes.text: It was found that the libcurl library did not check the client certificate when choosing the TLS connection to reuse. An attacker could potentially use this flaw to hijack the authentication of the connection by leveraging a previously created connection with a different client certificate.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: curl: Re-using connection with wrong client cert
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: It was found that the length checks prior to writing to the target buffer for creating a virtual host mapping rule did not take account of the length of the virtual host name, creating the potential for a buffer overflow.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: mod_jk: Buffer overflow when concatenating virtual host name and URI

vulnerabilities.title: mod_jk: Buffer overflow when concatenating virtual host name and URI

notes.text: It was found that the libcurl library using the NSS (Network Security Services) library as TLS/SSL backend incorrectly re-used client certificates for subsequent TLS connections in certain cases. An attacker could potentially use this flaw to hijack the authentication of the connection by leveraging a previously created connection with a different client certificate.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: curl: Incorrect reuse of client certificates
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: An error was found in protocol parsing logic of mod_cluster load balancer Apache HTTP Server modules. An attacker could use this flaw to cause a Segmentation Fault in the serving httpd process.
